definition: to deign/to condescend/to yield to (entreaties)/to submit to (sb)/(polite) to deign to accept (a post)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一樣，你的屈尊俯就總是讓人感激。

sentences.english: Oh! to be like Thee, lowly in spirit.
sentences.chinese: 主，我願像禰，謙遜俯就人。

sentences.english: Why would He keep coming to us?
sentences.chinese: 祂爲何樂意一直這樣俯就我們呢？

sentences.english: Yeltsin was polite and friendly, but slightly patronizing.
sentences.chinese: 葉利欽很客氣，很友好，稍微有點屈尊俯就的架勢。

sentences.english: Don’t be condescending, but do use simpler words when they are available.
sentences.chinese: 不要顯得屈尊俯就，但要儘量用簡明的詞語。

sentences.english: Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate.
sentences.chinese: 不要志氣高大，倒要俯就卑微的人。

definition: to make a concession/to be accommodating
to give oneself wholly to/to put oneself at sb's service/(of a woman) to give one's body to/to marry
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to bow and scrape/to act servilely
